text: Lucretia Lombard, also known as Flaming Passion, is a 1923 American silent drama film directed by Jack Conway and produced and distributed by Warner Bros. Based upon the 1922 novel of the same name by Kathleen Norris, it stars Irene Rich, Monte Blue and a young Norma Shearer, just prior to her signing with MGM.The AFI Catalog of Feature Films:Lucretia LombardProgressive Silent Film List: Lucretia Lombard at silentera.com ==Cast== *Irene Rich as Lucretia Lombard *Monte Blue as Stephen Winship *Marc McDermott as Sir Allen Lombard *Norma Shearer as Mimi *Alec B. Francis as Judge Winship *John Roche as Fred Winship *Lucy Beaumont as Mrs. Winship *Otto Hoffman as Sandy, Lombard's servant *Florence Lawrence ==Box office== According to Warner Bros records the film earned $348,000 domestically and $37,000 foreign. ==Preservation status== This film still survives at George Eastman House and Pacific Film Archive.The Library of Congress American Silent Feature Film Survival Catalog: Lucretia Lombard It was transferred onto 16mm film by Associated Artists Productions1957 Movies from AAP Warner Bros Features & Cartoons, Sales Book Directed at TV in the 1950s and shown on television. ==References== ==External links== * * Category:1923 films Category:American silent feature films Category:American films Category:Films directed by Jack Conway Category:Films based on American novels Category:Warner Bros. films Category:Films produced by Harry Rapf Category:1923 drama films Category:American black-and-white films Category:American drama films Category:Surviving American silent films
